Posted By: EyeballFrog (8/6/2013 11:28:44 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
And this raging powerhouse of a creature's drawback is WHAT...???  
  
See kids, this is why large, powerful creatures need significant drawbacks. When you "cheat" cards like this into play with Eureka, Show and Tell, Quicksilver Amulet, 3 lucky Dark Rituals, etc. there has to be a tradeoff, a risk, for doing so. Here, there is no risk. It's pure profit for nothing.  
  
Look at older big boys like [Lord of the Pit](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lord of the Pit), [Force of Nature](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Force of Nature), and the (slightly overcosted) Elder Dragon Legends. Their drawbacks were to make sure that they weren't too easy to cheat onto the battlefield. They were designed that way for a reason.  
  
Wizards, it's time to turn back the clock and do what you did right the first time.
posts.html:

Look at older big boys like Lord of the Pit, Force of Nature, and the (slightly overcosted) Elder Dragon Legends. Their drawbacks were to make sure that they weren't too easy to cheat onto the battlefield. They were designed that way for a reason.

Wizards, it's time to turn back the clock and do what you did right the first time.

posts.post_content:
It's the lifelink that's the real kick-in-the-balls. By the time he gets hardcast via chained rituals or gets reanimated, your life total would allow for 7 or 14 cards drawn. The former isn't totally backbreaking for your opponent, but the latter should be so long as you don't die.  
  
But these days Demons are so sweet they'll give you that life right back so you'll always win the game. How thoughtful.

But these days Demons are so sweet they'll give you that life right back so you'll always win the game. How thoughtful.

Posted By: Claytoon (9/7/2013 10:37:13 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Incredible card. Timmy sees a 7/7 with flying & lifelink. Johnny sees a nice toy for [Liliana](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liliana) & [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites). Spike sees a [Yawgmoth's Bargain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Yawgmoth's Bargain) with lifelink that doubles as a finisher.   
  
So many synergies, so little time.  
  
**Block**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Standard**: [Unburial Rites](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unburial Rites)  
**Extended**: [Fauna Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fauna Shaman) with [Necrotic Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrotic Ooze)  
**Modern**: [Goryo's Vengeance](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goryo's Vengeance)  
**Legacy**: [Dread Return](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dread Return), [Exhume](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exhume), [Animate Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Animate Dead), [Show and Tell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Show and Tell)  
**Vintage**: [Oath of Druids](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Oath of Druids), [Necromancy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necromancy), [Dance of the Dead](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dance of the Dead)

So many synergies, so little time.

Block: Unburial Rites
Standard: Unburial Rites
Extended: Fauna Shaman with Necrotic Ooze
Modern: Goryo's Vengeance
Legacy: Dread Return, Exhume, Animate Dead, Show and Tell
Vintage: Oath of Druids, Necromancy, Dance of the Dead

Posted By: YawgmothsWish (4/30/2012 4:04:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Paying life to draw cards has already proven to be broken (see [Necropotence](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necropotence)). With that card, you get them at the end of your turn. This one is an on demand draw engine, with lifelink and flying and a good body. And with all of the shenanigans black has to avoid paying for creatures, you probably won't need to hard cast it. 5/5
posts.html:
Paying life to draw cards has already proven to be broken (see Necropotence). With that card, you get them at the end of your turn. This one is an on demand draw engine, with lifelink and flying and a good body. And with all of the shenanigans black has to avoid paying for creatures, you probably won't need to hard cast it. 5/5

posts.post_content:
Let's see, lifelink damage, gain 7 life... I didn't need that 21 life anyway, right?  
Once at an FNM I saw a guy playing a [Fist of Suns](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fist of Suns) deck with [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn), [Avacyn, Angel of Hope](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Avacyn, Angel of Hope), and this jerk.  
The guy he played against had a lockdown control deck, featuring [Helvault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helvault), among other things.  
They won the event from sheer flavor points for exiling Avacyn and [Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griselbrand) to the [Helvault](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Helvault).

Posted By: LeoKula (11/27/2013 6:43:21 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Even Wizards talked about how people complain about this card not costing seven despite having 7s everywhere else. But I fail to see how this could have been solved in a better way.  
  
- Do they make him even more powerful by simply cutting a mana?  
- Do they change him to an 8/8 and his ability to Pay 8 life: draw eight cards, ruining the connection to the numerous "draw seven"s in Magic's past and make a ridiculous [Lorthos](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lorthos) impression?  
- Do they deliberately break the pattern by say, making him a eight mana 6/9 that draws seven cards for 7 life?  
  
It seems to me that the printed version is the most elegant by far.
posts.html:

- Do they deliberately break the pattern by say, making him a eight mana 6/9 that draws seven cards for 7 life?

It seems to me that the printed version is the most elegant by far.
